com.actinarium.rhythm.control

Class RhythmGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.actinarium.rhythm.control.RhythmGroup

  • public final class RhythmGroup
extends java.lang.Object

    Controls a group of RhythmDrawables, namely propagates the same RhythmOverlay for all registered RhythmDrawables to render. A RhythmGroup object holds onto a list of RhythmOverlays and allows cycling through them. Usually, Rhythm groups are used within a RhythmControl and instantiated via RhythmControl.makeGroup(String)) method, however you are free to make “orphaned” groups and control them explicitly from your app.

    Also contains convenience methods for easy decoration of existing views — those can simplify the scenario when you don’t want to include Rhythm into production builds.

    • Field Detail

      • NO_OVERLAY

        public static int NO_OVERLAY

    • Constructor Detail

      • RhythmGroup

        public RhythmGroup()

        Create a new Rhythm group.

        Heads up: do not explicitly call new RhythmGroup() unless you specifically don’t want it attached to a RhythmControl (i.e. don’t want it to appear in the Quick Control notification). Instead, you should use RhythmControl.makeGroup(String).

    • Method Detail

      • setTitle

        public RhythmGroup setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Set the title for this group. The title is only displayed in Rhythm control notification — you don't need it in programmatically created anonymous groups.
        Parameters:
        title - A convenient title for this group.
        Returns:
        this for chaining

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Get group title
        Returns:
        group title of null if the group is anonymous

      • addOverlay

        public RhythmGroup addOverlay(com.actinarium.rhythm.RhythmOverlay overlay)
        Add Rhythm overlay to this group
        Parameters:
        overlay - The Rhythm overlay to add
        Returns:
        this for chaining

      • addOverlays

        public RhythmGroup addOverlays(java.util.Collection<com.actinarium.rhythm.RhythmOverlay> overlays)
        Add multiple Rhythm overlays to this group
        Parameters:
        overlays - The Rhythm overlays to add
        Returns:
        this for chaining

      • makeDrawable

        public com.actinarium.rhythm.RhythmDrawable makeDrawable()
        Make a new RhythmDrawable that will draw the group’s active RhythmOverlay and can be used as any other Drawable in Android SDK. You must always make separate drawables for using them in different places, as reusing the same drawable instance may lead to unexpected results.
        Returns:
        A new RhythmDrawable controlled by this group.

      • decorate

        public void decorate(android.view.View... views)

        A handy method that will decorate provided views with RhythmDrawables controlled by this group.

        Note: the backgrounds of all provided views will be wrapped and replaced by RhythmDrawables. To obtain the original background drawables you have to call view.getBackground().getDecorated().

        Parameters:
        views - Views whose backgrounds should be decorated with Rhythm drawables
        See Also:
        decorateForeground(FrameLayout...)

      • decorateForeground

        public void decorateForeground(android.widget.FrameLayout... views)
        Similar to decorate(View...), but decorates foregrounds instead of backgrounds of provided views (available only for FrameLayout), therefore drawing the overlay over the view’s content. Similarly to decorate(View...), wraps and replaces existing foreground drawable with RhythmDrawable.
        Parameters:
        views - Frame layouts whose foregrounds should be decorated
        See Also:
        decorate(View...)

      • getCurrentOverlayIndex

        public int getCurrentOverlayIndex()
        Returns:
        Index of currently selected overlay, or NO_OVERLAY
        See Also:
        getCurrentOverlay(), getOverlayCount()

      • getOverlayCount

        public int getOverlayCount()
        Returns:
        Number of overlays associated with this group
        See Also:
        getCurrentOverlayIndex()

      • getCurrentOverlay

        public com.actinarium.rhythm.RhythmOverlay getCurrentOverlay()
        Returns:
        Currently selected overlay, or null if overlay is disabled
        See Also:
        getCurrentOverlayIndex()

      • selectOverlay

        public void selectOverlay(int index)
        Select overlay by index. Provide NO_OVERLAY to hide overlay.
        Parameters:
        index - Overlay index, or NO_OVERLAY
        See Also:
        selectNextOverlay(), getOverlayCount()

      • selectNextOverlay

        public void selectNextOverlay()
        Convenience method to cycle through overlays. Meant primarily for use in Quick Control notification, but can be invoked programmatically.
        See Also:
        selectOverlay(int)
